item.title: IronFox Shield

item.description:
@Tribbinator wrote:

Glad to see you back around here Arc, my suggestion on the shield is to add and object in the center of the shield (be it spikes, an emblem, or blood splatter) that would break up all that gold color.

@amy_webb1 wrote:

Just keep practicing, you’ll get a lot better. I still learn new things all the time, there is no limit to what techniques you can learn.

Read full topic

item.title: IronFox Shield
item.dc:creator: @The_Arcanian The Arcanian
item.description:
@The_Arcanian wrote:

[quote=“amy_webb, post:5, topic:479553”]I have made a model from the pictures you provided in order to show you the difference:

This came to a total of 672 face (triangulated), and took around half an hour to make and colour.

With wire frames, you only need the outside wire to shape the model, with the wire on the inside you can join the 2 or 3 closer ones together so that it looks cleaner and uses less poly. This is best displayed through the middle cross where you have lines like = instead of >< (think of them as lines instead of weird faces).

With shadowing, make a base colour and then clone it once, double click on the clone and change the ambient to make it lighter or darker, depending on how you would like it (i suggest that if you have a darker colour like black you go up, if you have a lighter colour like white you go down). Continue doing this until you have 3 or 4, depending on how many faces you have on the area you’re colouring. I used 5 for the base colour and 4 with the black.[/quote]

This is incredible difference between your model and mine. Thanks for the info, I will keep it in mind! (^_^)

Read full topic

item.title: IronFox Shield
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

I have made a model from the pictures you provided in order to show you the difference:

This came to a total of 672 face (triangulated), and took around half an hour to make and colour.

With wire frames, you only need the outside wire to shape the model, with the wire on the inside you can join the 2 or 3 closer ones together so that it looks cleaner and uses less poly. This is best displayed through the middle cross where you have lines like = instead of >< (think of them as lines instead of weird faces).

With shadowing, make a base colour and then clone it once, double click on the clone and change the ambient to make it lighter or darker, depending on how you would like it (i suggest that if you have a darker colour like black you go up, if you have a lighter colour like white you go down). Continue doing this until you have 3 or 4, depending on how many faces you have on the area you’re colouring. I used 5 for the base colour and 4 with the black.

Read full topic

item.title: IronFox Shield
item.dc:creator: @The_Arcanian The Arcanian
item.description:
@The_Arcanian wrote:

[quote=“amy_webb, post:3, topic:479553”]Do you make these designs yourself or you just modeling already seen ideas?

I’d like to give you a rundown on modeling for low poly and colouring with basic shadows, would you mind if i did? I just feel like it could help you a lot, but i don’t want to make modeling something you’d see as a job rather then something fun.[/quote]

Most of the things I make come out how they are while working on them. I just start with a block and then shape it as I feel like, so they are just my imagination. This particular sword is not my design. I saw it some time ago.
Yhea, well, went a little overkill on the size of the shield and i don’t like the colors much myself. Never been good with colors.
Modeling is always fun for me, even if it’s something someone requested me to do and I wouldn’t be making it any other way. I would love to hear some help from you, cuz I love your models!

Read full topic

item.title: IronFox Shield

@amy_webb1 wrote:

Do you make these designs yourself or you just modeling already seen ideas?

I’d like to give you a rundown on modeling for low poly and colouring with basic shadows, would you mind if i did? I just feel like it could help you a lot, but i don’t want to make modeling something you’d see as a job rather then something fun.
